intro: Utricularia rhododactylos, commonly known as the red-stem bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and specialized bladder-like structures used to trap prey. The plant typically grows in wet, nutrient-poor environments such as marshes and ponds. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Utricularia rhododactylos is an aquatic or semi-aquatic plant that relies on its unique trapping mechanism to obtain nutrients in its habitat.
